file_content.text: Ah! My old friend. Do forgive me--I'm quite busy with my research right now.
You made it! Did it work? Did the Red Engine produce an inscription?
I fed it blood, and it gave me this tablet.
After the fight, yes.
Yes. Can you translate the hieroglyphs on the stone?
Take a look.
The tablet of Tulak Hord? Inscribed in the language of the ancient Sith....
Yeah, yeah.
Yes. Oh yes. These are Tulak Hord's teachings--the very methods he used to build the terrible machine below!
I have dreamed of this tablet--dreamed of looking upon Tulak Hord's teachings and studying the arcane science of the dark side. I am honored you give me this opportunity.
May your madness bring you knowledge.
Learn well.
As you say, of course.
Remember that power comes from hate, not study.
Research isn't the Sith way.
But I do not seek power. I seek only to learn.
Take these--small relics I've unearthed that deserve to be used by a true Sith. Not a reward, but recognition of your strength.
Now, I must excuse myself, and my research must continue. It will be some time before the tablet gives up all its secrets.
How will you proceed?
I will complete my studies here. And when I am done... there will be other dead lords, other dreams, and perhaps other machines.
Don't waste it, archaeologist. I expect your studies to bear fruit.
As you should be.
Of course. When my studies here are complete, I shall lay all I have learned at the steps of the Academy... before leaving for another tomb.
I must excuse myself. But take these--a few relics I've unearthed that deserve to be held by a true Sith.
I beg of you--find the machine, and fuel it with blood!
My lord! Allow me to approach. The wind outside has torn my ears to tatters, and my eyes grow strained and bloody in the dark.
Come closer, acolyte! The wind outside has torn my ears to tatters, and my eyes grow strained and bloody in the dark.
I've studied this tomb for years--slept on its stones and dreamed of its depths. Now, I need assistance to solve its final mystery.
If you have secrets to share, I would learn them.
Fascinating.
Then listen to me, and to my story. Listen close.
I don't dig through dirt for scholars.
I'm not your laborer.
Then you misunderstand the chance I am offering.
And you are?
I am Ephran Zell. For generations, my family has studied the tombs of Korriban, traveling from one to the next to learn the history of the Sith.
Really? So are you mad or just obsessed?
Crazy man.
Why should my sanity matter to you?
This tomb is the final resting place of Tulak Hord. The tomb's maze was built to his precise specifications.
But he built his maze to hold more than just his body. He built it to secure his greatest creation--his terrible machine. The Red Engine.
Keep going. What "Red Engine"?
Machine?
Where do I come in?
Because I need you. The machine needs you.
I really don't share your fascination with history.
Not interested.
Tulak Hord had power and knowledge unknown in this age! Surely, that interests you?
The machine was his life's work--a perfect puzzle that hid all his secrets. It was a vault and a library all at once.
The scholars in the Academy--they say the Red Engine was never completed. They say it never functioned. But I know how it works, and I know how to fuel it.
What do you mean "fuel it"?
Fuel?
Then why not inform the scholars?
So tell the Academy.
They think that I--not a Sith, nor an educated man--couldn't discover the truth. They ignore my findings and are blinded by arrogance.
You're talking about a machine that's been here for centuries. If it still worked, the Sith would know by now.
It's probably broken.
A Sith's power comes from passion--not from decades of study and research. This is the only reason I've learned what they will not.
Listen, now. Anyone can activate the Red Engine--but unless it receives its sacrifice, it will only sputter and die.
The machine needs blood and hatred to become fully operational. If a Sith could slay the tomb's beasts in its presence, their deaths would be its fuel.
Broaden your mind! See what your fellows refuse to see. I promise you--it will be worth your while.
We'll see.
Thank you. You are wise among the Sith.
It may be worth an effort. You're certain this will work?
I'll look into it.
I have spent too many years learning the ways of the tomb, dreamed too many dreams, to be mistaken.
Why not go yourself?
My anger is not deep enough, nor my sword arm strong enough to satisfy the Red Engine's appetite. But you--you can do this.
Is there compensation?
I've found many a lesser artifact in my time within the tombs. I can spare a few to compensate you for your time.
Find the machine within the tomb--work its mechanisms.
And when at last it reveals Tulak Hord's secrets, I beg of you--bring me its scripture. Bring me the knowledge I have dreamed of.
We're done. [Refuse quest]
Yes--yes, of course. I will wait for another, then.
It seems unwise.
With respect, I suggest you stay away from this tomb--you are not ready for the darkness within.
Move along. There's nothing you can do to help with my research.
